title: Markets News, October 31, 2024: Stocks Tumble as Earnings Weigh on Big Tech; S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow Post Losses for the Month
text:
Major Indexes Post Monthly Losses The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite each finished October with monthly losses. For the Dow and S&P 500, it marked the end of five-month winning streaks, while the Nasdaq had its first down month since July. TradingView

Biggest S&P 500 Movers on Thursday Decliners The steepest drop in the S&P 500 hit shares of Huntington Ingalls Industries (HII), the largest military shipbuilding company in the U.S., which sank 26.2%. Third-quarter revenue and earnings per share (EPS) fell short of analysts' estimates, and Huntington Ingalls reduced its full-year sales forecast. The company said uncertainty about agreements with the U.S. Navy, as well as labor and supply chain issues, contributed to a weaker outlook for its shipbuilding business.

(HII), the largest military shipbuilding company in the U.S., which sank 26.2%. Third-quarter revenue and earnings per share (EPS) fell short of analysts' estimates, and Huntington Ingalls reduced its full-year sales forecast. The company said uncertainty about agreements with the U.S. Navy, as well as labor and supply chain issues, contributed to a weaker outlook for its shipbuilding business. Estée Lauder (EL) shares plunged 20.9% after the luxury beauty products firm withdrew its outlook for the full year and cut its dividend. The cosmetics maker also reported year-over-year declines in quarterly revenue and organic sales, citing weakness in China and Asia travel markets. Estée Lauder also announced a shakeup in its executive leadership, with Stéphane de La Faverie set to take over as chief executive officer (CEO) at the beginning of next year.

(EL) shares plunged 20.9% after the luxury beauty products firm withdrew its outlook for the full year and cut its dividend. The cosmetics maker also reported year-over-year declines in quarterly revenue and organic sales, citing weakness in China and Asia travel markets. Estée Lauder also announced a shakeup in its executive leadership, with Stéphane de La Faverie set to take over as chief executive officer (CEO) at the beginning of next year. Shares of automotive technology supplier Aptiv (APTV) dropped 17.7% following the company's third-quarter earnings release. Production challenges across the car industry, reduced customer scheduling, and bumps along the road to an electric vehicle (EV) future weighed on Aptiv's performance. Still, the company said it has adopted cost-cutting measures to adapt to the difficult environment. Advancers Paycom Software (PAYC) shares skyrocketed on Thursday, posting the top daily performance in the S&P 500 with a gain of 21.3%. The payroll and human resources (HR) software firm reported better-than-expected sales and profits for the third quarter, with strength in the labor market helping boost demand for its employee management solutions.

(PAYC) shares skyrocketed on Thursday, posting the top daily performance in the S&P 500 with a gain of 21.3%. The payroll and human resources (HR) software firm reported better-than-expected sales and profits for the third quarter, with strength in the labor market helping boost demand for its employee management solutions. Entergy (ETR) shares surged 15.2% after the Louisiana-based electric utility beat profit estimates for the third quarter and lifted its full-year outlook. Cost reductions helped drive the earnings beat, even as revenue slipped year-over-year, missing forecasts. Entergy also announced plans for several clean energy projects.

(ETR) shares surged 15.2% after the Louisiana-based electric utility beat profit estimates for the third quarter and lifted its full-year outlook. Cost reductions helped drive the earnings beat, even as revenue slipped year-over-year, missing forecasts. Entergy also announced plans for several clean energy projects. Pulp and paper products manufacturer International Paper (IP) topped profit estimates with its third-quarter results, and its shares climbed 13.3%. International Paper also said it is in the early stages of reviewing strategic options for its global cellulose fibers business and announced that it will close its mill in Georgetown, South Carolina. -Michael Bromberg

Apple Profit Comes in Shy of Estimates Apple (AAPL) reported fiscal fourth-quarter results that beat analysts' revenue expectations but missed on profit. The iPhone maker delivered record September-period revenue of $94.93 billion, up 6% year-over-year and above the $94.58 billion consensus estimate of analysts polled by Visible Alpha. Net income was $14.74 billion, or 97 cents per share, below expectations of $22.49 billion, or $1.48 per share. After stripping out a one-time income tax charge of $10.2 billion to reflect the impact of the reversal of the European General Court’s State Aid decision, adjusted EPS came in at $1.46. Apple produced $46.22 billion in iPhone revenue, above expectations of $45.32 billion. However, the iPhone 16’s September 20 release date came with less than two weeks to go in the quarter, meaning the bulk of that came from iPhone 15 and older models. The new iPhone 16 is displayed at an unveiling event at Apple's Cupertino, California headquarters on Sept. 9, 2024. David Paul Morris / Bloomberg / Getty Images The results come as the company is rolling out Apple Intelligence features, including a free iOS update for the iPhone 16 and other devices released Monday. Shares of Apple were down 2% in recent after-hours trading. -Andrew Kessel

Amazon Jumps After Hours on Earnings Beat, Cloud Growth Amazon (AMZN) stock jumped in extended trading Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected third-quarter results driven by growth in its cloud and advertising businesses. The company reported net sales of $158.9 billion, up 11% from the year-ago period and above the $157.3 billion Wall Street expected, according to analyst estimates compiled by Visible Alpha. Earnings per share (EPS) grew more than 50% to $1.43, beating analysts’ forecasts. Amazon stock rose nearly 5% in extended trading on Thursday, after declining more than 3% in the regular session. Still, shares were up 22% for the year before the stock’s post-earnings jump, slightly outpacing the Nasdaq Composite over the same period. TradingView Revenue at Amazon Web Services, the company’s cloud computing unit, rose 19% to $27.4 billion, roughly in line with expectations. The division’s revenue growth has accelerated into the high teens this year after holding in the low teens in 2023. Amazon forecast fourth-quarter net sales would be within a range of $183.5 billion to $188.5 billion, the midpoint of which sat slightly below the $186.4 billion figure analysts were expecting, per Visible Alpha.

Advertising sales increased 19% to $14.3 billion, about in line with analysts' expectations for one of Amazon’s greenest and fastest-growing revenue streams. Capital expenditures (CapEx) increased 5% from last year to $22.2 billion. Amazon, locked in an AI arms race with cloud-computing peers Microsoft (MSFT) and Alphabet (GOOG; GOOGL), has significantly boosted its spending on data center infrastructure this year.

-Colin Laidley

Intel Jumps in Extended Trading as Sales Top Estimates Intel (INTC) reported third-quarter revenue that topped analysts' expectations, sending shares higher after the bell Thursday despite widening losses. The chipmaker's third-quarter revenue fell 6% year-over-year to $13.3 billion, above the $13.03 billion consensus estimate of analysts compiled by Visible Alpha. Intel posted a wider-than-expected loss of $16.6 billion, after reporting a $1.61 billion loss in the second quarter as the chipmaker works to cut costs. A year ago, the chipmaker had reported a profit of around $300 million. Intel said it anticipates fourth-quarter revenue of $13.3 billion to $14.3 billion, compared to a consensus estimate of $13.66 billion. It projects a loss of 24 cents per share, steeper than the loss of 12 cents per share analysts had been expecting. Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger speaks during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on June 4, 2024. Annabelle Chih / Bloomberg / Getty Images Intel's results come as the storied chipmaker tries to turn around the business after losing market share to competitors and missing key opportunities to benefit from the boom in demand for artificial intelligence (AI). Shares took a hit in recent months as worries mounted about its ability to engineer a comeback after reporting wider-than-expected losses in the prior quarter and announcing massive layoffs. Intel shares were up 9% in recent after-hours trading. The stock was down more than 57% for the year through Thursday's close, making it one of the worst-performing S&P 500 stocks of the year. -Kara Greenberg



What Analysts Think of Apple Heading Into Earnings Apple (AAPL) will report fiscal fourth-quarter earnings after the market closes on Thursday, with a majority of analysts bullish on the stock going into the company’s first report since the iPhone 16’s release last month. Of the 15 analysts covering the stock tracked by Visible Alpha, nine have “buy” or equivalent ratings, four have “hold” ratings, and two have “sell.” Their consensus price estimate is $240.87. Apple shares were down 1.4% at $226.90 in late trading Thursday. -Andrew Kessel

Estée Lauder Stock Dives on China Softness, Dividend Cut Estée Lauder (EL) shares tanked 20% Thursday after the luxury beauty products maker warned about softness in China and the Asia travel market, pulled its full-year guidance, and cut its dividend. The news came a day after the company named Executive Group President Stéphane de La Faverie its new Chief Executive Officer (CEO), effective Jan. 1. Estée Lauder reported fiscal 2025 first-quarter revenue fell 4% year-over-year to $3.36 billion, while analysts surveyed by Visible Alpha expected $3.37 billion. Adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $0.14 exceeded forecasts. Organic sales declined 5%, which the company blamed primarily on "worsened consumer sentiment in China that drove further softening in overall prestige beauty in mainland China and low conversion rates in Asia travel retail and Hong Kong SAR." Organic sales were also dragged down by "lower replenishment orders in Asia travel retail, including inventory pressure given the further retail market deceleration." Faris Hadziq / SOPA Images / LightRocket via Getty Images Estée Lauder explained that because of the "complex prestige beauty landscape" and uncertainty about the recovery of the China and Asia travel markets, it was reducing its quarterly dividend to $0.35 from $0.66.3 In addition, it cited those factors, plus the change in leadership, for the decision to withdraw its fiscal 2025 outlook. It previously had anticipated adjusted EPS of $2.75 to $2.95, and revenue "between a decrease of 1% to an increase of 2% versus the prior year." -Bill McColl

Robinhood Stock Sinks as Promotions Hurt Earnings Robinhood Markets (HOOD) shares sank 15% Thursday, a day after the online brokerage posted worse-than-expected results as a promotion to get more customers affected performance. The company posted third-quarter earnings per share (EPS) of $0.17, with revenue jumping 36% year-over-year to $637 million. Both were short of consensus forecasts by analysts polled by Visible Alpha. Robinhood said that revenue was reduced by $27 million "due to matches paid to customers on transfers and deposits." CFO Jason Warnick said in the earnings call that these "contra revenues" are anticipated to grow sequentially by a similar amount in the current quarter, before slowing next year, according to a transcript provided by AlphaSense. Warnick noted that the company's gold deposit boost "has not driven as much incremental customer activity as our other promotions." Still, Robinhood noted that an increase in gold subscriptions was the primary reason its "other revenues" gained 42%. Transaction-based revenues were up 72% on higher options, cryptocurrency, and equities trades. Net interest revenues climbed 9%. TradingView Shares of Robinhood Markets fell from a nearly three-year high, but even so, they're up almost 90% year-to-date. They got a boost earlier this week when the company announced it was offering clients the ability to trade on the outcome of the U.S. presidential election. -Bill McColl

Microsoft Stock Slumps on Disappointing Forecast Shares of Microsoft (MSFT) slid on Thursday after the company’s revenue forecast fell short of Wall Street’s estimates and the cloud computing giant struggles to meet demand. Shares were down nearly 6% Thursday morning, weighing on the shares of some of its Big Tech peers. The slump slashed the stock's year-to-date gain—once as high as 24%—to just 8%. Microsoft on Wednesday forecast revenue at its Intelligent Cloud division would grow 18% to 20% in the current quarter, below analysts’ estimates. Growth of Azure, its cloud-computing platform, is expected to come in around 31% or 32%, a deceleration from the most recent quarter and slightly slower than Wall Street expected. The disappointing forecast overshadowed the company’s fiscal first-quarter results, which broadly exceeded expectations. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella speaks during the company event on AI technologies in Jakarta, Indonesia, on Tuesday, April 30, 2024. Dimas Ardian / Bloomberg / Getty Images Microsoft has struggled to meet surging AI demand, a difficulty executives expect to persist in the current quarter. CFO Amy Hood on the company's earnings call expressed confidence that growth would pick up in the first half of next year as more cloud computing capacity came online. Analysts on Thursday were sanguine about the outlook. They pointed to comments from executives indicating demand for AI services remains strong, and that the company’s increased spending on AI infrastructure should help it to meet that demand in the future. Read the full article here. -Colin Laidley

Peloton Soars After Strong Results, Naming of CEO Shares of fitness company Peloton Interactive (PTON) soared 25% in early trading Thursday after its fiscal first-quarter results topped analysts' estimates and it appointed Ford executive Peter Stern as its new CEO. Peloton reported a net loss of just $1 million, an improvement of $158 million year-over-year and much narrower than the $51.7 million loss expected by analysts polled by Visible Alpha. Revenue of $586.0 million also surpassed projections. Stern, who currently serves as president of Ford Integrated Services and previously was an executive at Apple (AAPL), will begin his new roles on Jan. 1. In May, Peloton announced Barry McCarthy was stepping down as CEO and that the board had "initiated a comprehensive search process" to find its next leader. With today's surge, Peloton has gained 35% in 2024, far outpacing the S&P 500's gains. -Rob McLean

Uber Stock Plunges as Q3 Bookings Numbers Disappoint Uber Technologies (UBER) shares fell sharply early Thursday after the ride-hailing giant posted weaker-than-expected gross bookings in the third quarter. The company said gross bookings rose 16% year-over-year to $41 billion in the third quarter, below estimates from Visible Alpha of $41.3 billion. Trips grew 17% to 2.9 billion, in line with estimates. Uber's top- and bottom-line results handily beat analysts' estimates, however. The company reported revenue for the period of $11.19 billion versus the $10.98 billion estimate. Net income of $2.6 billion also beat estimates by a wide margin, although that included a $1.7 billion pre-tax benefit from gains in Uber's revaluation of its equity investments. Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi noted that the company is continuing "to advance our autonomous strategy." Uber has announced a number of partnerships with autonomous vehicle companies like Waymo over the last several months. TradingView Uber shares were down 9% in recent trading. The stock, which hit a record high three weeks ago, has gained 17% since the start of the year.

-Nisha Gopalan

Carvana Levels to Watch as Stock Surges After Earnings Carvana (CVNA) shares soared in premarket trading after the online car dealer blew past Wall Street’s third-quarter earnings estimates and raised its full-year outlook. The stock has recently reclaimed the 200-week moving average and sits poised to break out above the upper trendline of a rising wedge pattern. The stock was up 19% at around $246 about 45 minutes before Thursday's opening bell. Source: TradingView.com. Investors should monitor key overhead price levels on Carvana's chart around $240, $300, and $365. During retracements, investors should closely monitor the $165 level, a location where the shares would likely attract buying interest near the September 2020 pullback low and January 2022 countertrend high. Read the full technical analysis piece here. -Timothy Smith

,"headline": "Markets News, October 31, 2024: Stocks Tumble as Earnings Weigh on Big Tech; S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow Post Losses for the Month"
,"liveBlogUpdate": [
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Major Indexes Post Monthly Losses<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T19:08:29.117-04:00"
,"articleBody": " The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite each finished October with monthly losses. For the Dow and S&P 500, it marked the end of five-month winning streaks, while the Nasdaq had its first down month since July. "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t230829117z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Biggest S&P 500 Movers on Thursday<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T18:51:31.599-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Decliners \n The steepest drop in the S&P 500 hit shares of Huntington Ingalls Industries ( HII ), the largest military shipbuilding company in the U.S., which sank 26.2%. Third-quarter revenue and earnings per share (EPS) fell short of analysts' estimates, and Huntington Ingalls reduced its full-year sales forecast. The company said uncertainty about agreements with the U.S. Navy, as well as labor and supply chain issues, contributed to a weaker outlook for its shipbuilding business. \n Estée Lauder ( EL ) shares plunged 20.9% after the luxury beauty products firm  withdrew its outlook  for the full year and cut its dividend. The cosmetics maker also reported year-over-year declines in quarterly revenue and organic sales, citing weakness in China and Asia travel markets. Estée Lauder also announced a shakeup in its executive leadership, with Stéphane de La Faverie set to take over as chief executive officer (CEO) at the beginning of next year. \n Shares of automotive technology supplier Aptiv ( APTV ) dropped 17.7% following the company's third-quarter earnings release. Production challenges across the car industry, reduced customer scheduling, and bumps along the road to an electric vehicle (EV) future weighed on Aptiv's performance. Still, the company said it has adopted cost-cutting measures to adapt to the difficult environment. \n Advancers \n Paycom Software ( PAYC ) shares skyrocketed on Thursday, posting the top daily performance in the S&P 500 with a gain of 21.3%. The payroll and human resources (HR) software firm reported better-than-expected sales and profits for the third quarter, with strength in the labor market helping boost demand for its employee management solutions. \n Entergy ( ETR ) shares surged 15.2% after the Louisiana-based electric utility beat profit estimates for the third quarter and lifted its full-year outlook. Cost reductions helped drive the earnings beat, even as revenue slipped year-over-year, missing forecasts. Entergy also announced plans for several clean energy projects. \n Pulp and paper products manufacturer International Paper ( IP ) topped profit estimates with its third-quarter results, and its shares climbed 13.3%. International Paper also said it is in the early stages of reviewing strategic options for its global cellulose fibers business and announced that it will close its mill in Georgetown, South Carolina. \n - Michael Bromberg "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t225131599z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Apple Profit Comes in Shy of Estimates<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T18:06:39.680-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Apple ( AAPL ) reported fiscal fourth-quarter results that beat analysts' revenue expectations but missed on profit. The iPhone maker delivered record September-period revenue of $94.93 billion, up 6% year-over-year and above the $94.58 billion consensus estimate of analysts polled by Visible Alpha. Net income was $14.74 billion, or 97 cents per share, below expectations of $22.49 billion, or $1.48 per share. After stripping out a one-time income tax charge of $10.2 billion to reflect the impact of the reversal of the European General Court’s State Aid decision, adjusted EPS came in at $1.46. Apple produced $46.22 billion in iPhone revenue, above expectations of $45.32 billion. However, the iPhone 16’s  September 20 release date  came with less than two weeks to go in the quarter, meaning the bulk of that came from iPhone 15 and older models.  The results come as the company is rolling out Apple Intelligence features, including a  free iOS update  for the iPhone 16 and other devices released Monday. Shares of Apple were down 2% in recent after-hours trading. - Andrew Kessel "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t220639680z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Amazon Jumps After Hours on Earnings Beat, Cloud Growth<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T17:43:32.668-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Amazon ( AMZN ) stock jumped in extended trading Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected third-quarter results driven by growth in its cloud and advertising businesses. The company reported net sales of $158.9 billion, up 11% from the year-ago period and above the $157.3 billion Wall Street expected, according to analyst estimates compiled by Visible Alpha.  Earnings per share  (EPS) grew more than 50% to $1.43, beating analysts’ forecasts. Amazon stock rose nearly 5% in extended trading on Thursday, after declining more than 3% in the regular session. Still, shares were up 22% for the year before the stock’s post-earnings jump, slightly outpacing the Nasdaq Composite over the same period. Revenue at Amazon Web Services, the company’s cloud computing unit, rose 19% to $27.4 billion, roughly in line with expectations. The division’s revenue growth has accelerated into the high teens this year after holding in the low teens in 2023. Amazon forecast fourth-quarter net sales would be within a range of $183.5 billion to $188.5 billion, the midpoint of which sat slightly below the $186.4 billion figure analysts were expecting, per Visible Alpha. Advertising sales increased 19% to $14.3 billion, about in line with analysts' expectations for one of Amazon’s greenest and fastest-growing revenue streams.  Capital expenditures  (CapEx) increased 5% from last year to $22.2 billion. Amazon, locked in an AI arms race with cloud-computing peers Microsoft ( MSFT ) and Alphabet ( GOOG ;  GOOGL ), has significantly boosted its spending on data center infrastructure this year. - Colin Laidley "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t214332668z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Intel Jumps in Extended Trading as Sales Top Estimates<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T17:14:39.895-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Intel ( INTC ) reported third-quarter revenue that topped analysts' expectations, sending shares higher after the bell Thursday despite widening losses. The chipmaker's third-quarter revenue fell 6% year-over-year to $13.3 billion, above the $13.03 billion consensus estimate of analysts compiled by Visible Alpha. Intel posted a wider-than-expected loss of $16.6 billion, after reporting a $1.61 billion loss in the second quarter as the chipmaker works to cut costs. A year ago, the chipmaker had reported a profit of around $300 million.  Intel said it anticipates fourth-quarter revenue of $13.3 billion to $14.3 billion, compared to a consensus estimate of $13.66 billion. It projects a loss of 24 cents per share, steeper than the loss of 12 cents per share analysts had been expecting.  Intel's results come as the storied chipmaker tries to turn around the business after  losing market share to competitors  and missing key opportunities to benefit from the boom in demand for  artificial intelligence (AI) . Shares took a hit in recent months as worries mounted about its ability to  engineer a comeback  after  reporting wider-than-expected losses in the prior quarter  and announcing massive layoffs. Intel shares were up 9% in recent after-hours trading. The stock was down more than 57% for the year through Thursday's close, making it one of the worst-performing S&P 500 stocks of the year. - Kara Greenberg "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t211439895z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>What Analysts Think of Apple Heading Into Earnings<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T15:48:19.939-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Apple ( AAPL ) will report  fiscal fourth-quarter earnings  after the market closes on Thursday, with a majority of analysts bullish on the stock going into the company’s first report since the iPhone 16’s release last month. Of the 15 analysts covering the stock tracked by Visible Alpha, nine have “buy” or equivalent ratings, four have “hold” ratings, and two have “sell.” Their consensus price estimate is $240.87. Apple shares were down 1.4% at $226.90 in late trading Thursday. - Andrew Kessel "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t194819939z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Estée Lauder Stock Dives on China Softness, Dividend Cut<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T14:23:59.325-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Estée Lauder ( EL ) shares tanked 20% Thursday after the luxury beauty products maker warned about softness in China and the Asia travel market, pulled its full-year guidance, and cut its dividend. The news came a day after the company named Executive Group President Stéphane de La Faverie its new  Chief Executive Officer (CEO) , effective Jan. 1. Estée Lauder reported fiscal 2025 first-quarter revenue fell 4% year-over-year to $3.36 billion, while analysts surveyed by Visible Alpha expected $3.37 billion. Adjusted  earnings per share (EPS)  of $0.14 exceeded forecasts. Organic sales  declined 5%, which the company blamed primarily on \"worsened consumer sentiment in China that drove further softening in overall prestige beauty in mainland China and low conversion rates in Asia travel retail and Hong Kong SAR.\" Organic sales were also dragged down by \"lower replenishment orders in Asia travel retail, including inventory pressure given the further retail market deceleration.\" Estée Lauder explained that because of the "complex prestige beauty landscape" and uncertainty about the recovery of the China and Asia travel markets, it was reducing its quarterly dividend to $0.35 from $0.66.3 In addition, it cited those factors, plus the change in leadership, for the decision to withdraw its fiscal 2025 outlook. It previously had anticipated adjusted EPS of $2.75 to $2.95, and revenue "between a decrease of 1% to an increase of 2% versus the prior year." - Bill McColl "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t182359325z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Robinhood Stock Sinks as Promotions Hurt Earnings<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T13:09:50.095-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Robinhood Markets ( HOOD ) shares sank 15% Thursday, a day after the online brokerage posted worse-than-expected results as a promotion to get more customers affected performance. The company posted third-quarter  earnings per share (EPS)  of $0.17, with revenue jumping 36% year-over-year to $637 million. Both were short of consensus forecasts by analysts polled by Visible Alpha. Robinhood said that revenue was reduced by $27 million "due to matches paid to customers on transfers and deposits." CFO Jason Warnick said in the earnings call that these "contra revenues" are anticipated to grow sequentially by a similar amount in the current quarter, before slowing next year, according to a transcript provided by AlphaSense. Warnick noted that the company's gold deposit boost "has not driven as much incremental customer activity as our other promotions." Still, Robinhood noted that an increase in gold subscriptions was the primary reason its "other revenues" gained 42%. Transaction-based revenues were up 72% on higher options, cryptocurrency, and equities trades. Net interest revenues climbed 9%. Shares of Robinhood Markets fell from a nearly three-year high, but even so, they're up almost 90% year-to-date. They got a boost earlier this week when the company announced it was  offering  clients the ability to trade on the outcome of the U.S. presidential election. - Bill McColl "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t170950095z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Microsoft Stock Slumps on Disappointing Forecast<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T11:57:49.648-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Shares of Microsoft ( MSFT ) slid on Thursday after the company’s revenue forecast fell short of Wall Street’s estimates   and   the cloud computing giant struggles to meet demand.  Shares were down nearly 6% Thursday morning, weighing on the shares of some of its Big Tech peers. The slump slashed the stock's year-to-date gain—once as high as 24%—to just 8%. Microsoft on Wednesday forecast revenue at its Intelligent Cloud division would grow 18% to 20% in the current quarter, below analysts’ estimates. Growth of Azure, its cloud-computing platform, is expected to come in around 31% or 32%, a deceleration from the most recent quarter and slightly slower than Wall Street expected. The disappointing forecast overshadowed the company’s fiscal first-quarter results, which broadly  exceeded expectations .  Microsoft has struggled to meet surging AI demand, a difficulty executives  expect to persist  in the current quarter. CFO Amy Hood on the company's earnings call expressed confidence that growth would pick up in the first half of next year as more cloud computing capacity came online. Analysts on Thursday were sanguine about the outlook. They pointed to comments from executives indicating demand for AI services remains strong, and that the company’s increased spending on AI infrastructure should help it to meet that demand in the future.  Read the full article here. - Colin Laidley "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t155749648z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Peloton Soars After Strong Results, Naming of CEO<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T10:43:36.595-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Shares of fitness company Peloton Interactive ( PTON ) soared 25% in early trading Thursday after its fiscal first-quarter results topped analysts' estimates and it appointed Ford executive Peter Stern as its new CEO. Peloton reported a net loss of just $1 million, an improvement of $158 million year-over-year and much narrower than the $51.7 million loss expected by analysts polled by Visible Alpha. Revenue of $586.0 million also surpassed projections. Stern, who currently serves as president of Ford Integrated Services and previously was an executive at Apple ( AAPL ), will begin his new roles on Jan. 1. In May, Peloton announced Barry McCarthy was stepping down as CEO and that the board had \"initiated a comprehensive search process\" to find its next leader. With today's surge, Peloton has gained 35% in 2024, far outpacing the S&P 500's gains. - Rob McLean "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t144336595z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Uber Stock Plunges as Q3 Bookings Numbers Disappoint<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T10:22:57.760-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Uber Technologies  ( UBER ) shares fell sharply early Thursday after the ride-hailing giant posted weaker-than-expected gross bookings in the third quarter. The company said gross bookings rose 16% year-over-year to $41 billion in the third quarter, below estimates from Visible Alpha of $41.3 billion. Trips grew 17% to 2.9 billion, in line with estimates.  Uber's top- and bottom-line results handily  beat analysts'  estimates, however. The company reported revenue for the period of $11.19 billion versus the $10.98 billion estimate.  Net income  of $2.6 billion also beat estimates by a wide margin, although that included a $1.7 billion pre-tax benefit from gains in Uber's revaluation of its equity investments. Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi noted that the company is continuing \"to advance our autonomous strategy.\" Uber has announced a  number of partnerships  with autonomous vehicle companies like Waymo over the last several months. Uber shares were down 9% in recent trading. The stock, which hit a record high three weeks ago, has gained 17% since the start of the year. - Nisha Gopalan "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t142257760z"
}
,
{
"@type": "BlogPosting"
,"headline": "<p><strong>Carvana Levels to Watch as Stock Surges After Earnings<\/strong><\/p>"
,"datePublished": "2024-10-31T08:50:22.953-04:00"
,"articleBody": " Carvana ( CVNA ) shares soared in premarket trading after the online car dealer blew past Wall Street’s third-quarter earnings estimates and raised its full-year outlook. The stock has recently reclaimed the 200-week moving average and sits poised to break out above the upper trendline of a rising wedge pattern. The stock was up 19% at around $246 about 45 minutes before Thursday's opening bell. Investors should monitor key overhead price levels on Carvana's chart around $240, $300, and $365. During retracements, investors should closely monitor the $165 level, a location where the shares would likely attract buying interest near the September 2020 pullback low and January 2022 countertrend high. Read the full technical analysis piece here. - Timothy Smith "
,"url": "https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t125022953z"
}

<header id="article-header_1-0" class="comp article-header mntl-block right-rail__offset js-toc-appear"><h1 id="article-heading_1-0" class="comp article-heading mntl-text-block">Markets News, October 31, 2024: Stocks Tumble as Earnings Weigh on Big Tech; S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow Post Losses for the Month</h1>

</div><div class="loc article-content"><div id="article__primary-video-container--jw_1-0" class="comp article__primary-video-container--jw mntl-block"></div>
<div id="liveblog_1-0" class="comp liveblog mntl-block"><div id="mntl-block_12-0" class="comp mntl-block article-content__description"><p id="mntl-sc-block_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <em>NOTE: The Live Markets Blog for Nov. 1, 2024 can be found <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-11012024-8738127" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">at this link.</a></em>
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_2-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Major U.S. indexes closed sharply lower Thursday, led by a sell-off in shares of big technology companies, as investors assessed a flurry of earnings reports and braced for more corporate results after the closing bell.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_3-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The Nasdaq Composite fell 2.8%, while the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 1.9% and 0.9%, respectively. <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10302024-8736592" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Thursday marked the second straight day</a> that the Nasdaq led the move lower, after the tech-heavy index hit an all-time high early in yesterday's trading session.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_4-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> With the steep downturn Thursday, the major indexes posted losses for the month of October. It was the first time since July that the Nasdaq didn't record a monthly gain, while the S&P 500 and Dow had five-month winning streaks snapped.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_5-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Tech stocks were in focus once again Thursday as Microsoft (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=MSFT" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">MSFT</a>) fell 6.1% after issuing a disappointing forecast, while shares of Meta Platforms (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=META" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">META</a>) retreated 4.1% after releasing its quarterly results and announcing plans to boost AI-related spending. Apple (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=AAPL" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">AAPL</a>), Amazon (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=AMZN" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="4">AMZN</a>) and Intel (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=INTC" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="5">INTC</a>) all lost ground, ahead of the releases of their earnings reports after the closing bell. AI investor favorite Nvidia (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=NVDA" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="6">NVDA</a>) finished 4.7% lower.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_6-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Among other noteworthy post-earnings-report movers, pharmaceuticals giant Merck (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=MRK" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">MRK</a>) was down 2.4%, beer maker AB InBev (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=BUD" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">BUD</a>) fell 5.6%, and ride-hailing company Uber Technologies (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=UBER" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">UBER</a>) declined 9.3%. Robinhood Markets (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=HOOD" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="4">HOOD</a>) and streamer Roku (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=ROKU" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="5">ROKU</a>) were both down more than 16%. Comcast (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=CMCSA" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="6">CMCSA</a>) shares were up 3.4% after the telecom and media conglomerate reported better-than-expected results, while online used-car dealer Carvana (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=CVNA" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="7">CVNA</a>) surged 19%.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_7-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Super Micro Computer (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=SMCI" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">SMCI</a>) shares plunged for the second day in a row as investors continue responding to news that the <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/super-micro-computer-stock-plummets-as-ey-resigns-as-company-auditor-8736619" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">server maker's auditor had resigned</a>. The stock's 12% decline Thursday came on the heels of a 33% drop yesterday, putting it back to near unchanged for the year.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_8-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> On the economic data front this morning, weekly jobless claims figures came in slightly lower than expected, while the latest reading on the Federal Reserve's preferred measure of inflation was<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/fed-s-favorite-inflation-gauge-fell-in-september-8737361" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"> in line with economists' estimates</a>. Investors are watching all the data points closely as they look for signs that the economy remains on sound footing, as well as information that could influence the Fed's upcoming decisions on interest rates. The big data event of the week comes Friday with the release of the <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/hiring-likely-took-big-hit-in-october-8735573" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">October jobs report</a>.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_9-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The yield on 10-year Treasurys, which is sensitive to expectations around interest rates, was at 4.28% late Thursday, up from 4.26% yesterday. The yield has been rising in recent weeks as market participants have recalibrated their thinking about how aggressive the Fed will be in cutting its benchmark lending rate.<br/>
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_10-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Gold futures fell to around $2,755 an ounce, after rising above $2,800 on Wednesday for the first time ever. Bitcoin was around $70,000, down from $72,500 earlier in the day.<br/>
</p></div>
<div id="liveblog__content_1-0" class="comp liveblog__content mntl-sc-page mntl-block " data-sc-sticky-offset="80" data-sc-ad-label-height="0" data-sc-ad-track-spacing="90" data-sc-min-track-height="250" data-sc-max-track-height="600" data-sc-breakpoint="50em" data-rail-bp="mntl-bp-md" data-sc-load-immediate="1" data-sc-content-positions="[1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18]" data-bind-scroll-on-start="true"><div id="finance-liveblog-content_1-0" class="comp finance-liveblog-content mntl-liveblog-content mntl-block"><div id="mntl-liveblog-item_1-0" class="comp mntl-liveblog-item mntl-block"><span class="heading-toc" id="toc-2024-10-31t230829117z"></span>
<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_1-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Major Indexes Post Monthly Losses</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_1-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 07:08 PM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_1-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t230829117z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_11-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite each finished October with monthly losses.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_12-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> For the Dow and S&P 500, it marked the end of five-month winning streaks, while the Nasdaq had its first down month since July.
</p>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_13-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-universal-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme mntl-sc-block-image inline-image figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_2-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Biggest S&P 500 Movers on Thursday</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_2-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 06:51 PM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_2-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t225131599z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_14-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <strong><u>Decliners</u></strong>
</p>
<ul id="mntl-sc-block_15-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html">
<li>The steepest drop in the S&P 500 hit shares of <strong>Huntington Ingalls Industries </strong>(<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=hii" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">HII</a>), the largest military shipbuilding company in the U.S., which sank 26.2%. Third-quarter revenue and earnings per share (EPS) fell short of analysts' estimates, and Huntington Ingalls reduced its full-year sales forecast. The company said uncertainty about agreements with the U.S. Navy, as well as labor and supply chain issues, contributed to a weaker outlook for its shipbuilding business.</li>
<li><strong>Estée Lauder </strong>(<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=el" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">EL</a>) shares plunged 20.9% after the luxury beauty products firm <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/estee-lauder-stock-dives-on-china-warning-dividend-cut-withdrawn-outlook-8737614" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">withdrew its outlook</a> for the full year and cut its dividend. The cosmetics maker also reported year-over-year declines in quarterly revenue and organic sales, citing weakness in China and Asia travel markets. Estée Lauder also announced a shakeup in its executive leadership, with Stéphane de La Faverie set to take over as chief executive officer (CEO) at the beginning of next year.</li>
<li>Shares of automotive technology supplier <strong>Aptiv</strong> (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=aptv" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="4">APTV</a>) dropped 17.7% following the company's third-quarter earnings release. Production challenges across the car industry, reduced customer scheduling, and bumps along the road to an electric vehicle (EV) future weighed on Aptiv's performance. Still, the company said it has adopted cost-cutting measures to adapt to the difficult environment.</li>
</ul>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_16-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <strong><u>Advancers</u></strong>
</p>
<ul id="mntl-sc-block_17-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html">
<li><strong>Paycom Software</strong> (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=payc" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">PAYC</a>) shares skyrocketed on Thursday, posting the top daily performance in the S&P 500 with a gain of 21.3%. The payroll and human resources (HR) software firm reported better-than-expected sales and profits for the third quarter, with strength in the labor market helping boost demand for its employee management solutions.</li>
<li><strong>Entergy</strong> (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=etr" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">ETR</a>) shares surged 15.2% after the Louisiana-based electric utility beat profit estimates for the third quarter and lifted its full-year outlook. Cost reductions helped drive the earnings beat, even as revenue slipped year-over-year, missing forecasts. Entergy also announced plans for several clean energy projects.</li>
<li>Pulp and paper products manufacturer <strong>International Paper</strong> (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=ip" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">IP</a>) topped profit estimates with its third-quarter results, and its shares climbed 13.3%. International Paper also said it is in the early stages of reviewing strategic options for its global cellulose fibers business and announced that it will close its mill in Georgetown, South Carolina.</li>
</ul>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_18-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> -<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/contributors/58207/" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"><em>Michael Bromberg</em></a>
</p></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-adslot_2-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block" data-item-index="2"></div>
<div id="mntl-liveblog-item_3-0" class="comp mntl-liveblog-item mntl-block"><span class="heading-toc" id="toc-2024-10-31t220639680z"></span>
<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_3-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Apple Profit Comes in Shy of Estimates</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_3-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 06:06 PM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_3-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t220639680z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_19-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Apple (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=AAPL" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">AAPL</a>) reported fiscal fourth-quarter results that beat analysts' revenue expectations but missed on profit.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_20-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The iPhone maker delivered record September-period revenue of $94.93 billion, up 6% year-over-year and above the $94.58 billion consensus estimate of analysts polled by Visible Alpha.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_21-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Net income was $14.74 billion, or 97 cents per share, below expectations of $22.49 billion, or $1.48 per share. After stripping out a one-time income tax charge of $10.2 billion to reflect the impact of the reversal of the European General Court’s State Aid decision, adjusted EPS came in at $1.46.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_22-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Apple produced $46.22 billion in iPhone revenue, above expectations of $45.32 billion. However, the iPhone 16’s <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/apple-s-iphone-16-goes-on-sale-today-without-latest-ai-features-8715789" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">September 20 release date</a> came with less than two weeks to go in the quarter, meaning the bulk of that came from iPhone 15 and older models. 
</p>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_23-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-universal-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme mntl-sc-block-image inline-image figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_24-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The results come as the company is rolling out Apple Intelligence features, including a <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/apple-releases-new-ai-features-and-imac-what-you-neapple-releases-new-ai-features-on-iphones-and-fresh-hues-on-imacs-8735403" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">free iOS update</a> for the iPhone 16 and other devices released Monday.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_25-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Shares of Apple were down 2% in recent after-hours trading.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_26-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> -<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/andrew-kessel-8670381" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"><em>Andrew Kessel</em></a>
</p></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-adslot_3-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block" data-item-index="3"></div>
<div id="mntl-liveblog-item_4-0" class="comp mntl-liveblog-item mntl-block"><span class="heading-toc" id="toc-2024-10-31t214332668z"></span>
<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_4-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Amazon Jumps After Hours on Earnings Beat, Cloud Growth</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_4-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 05:43 PM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_4-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t214332668z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_27-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=AMZN" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">AMZN</a>) stock jumped in extended trading Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected third-quarter results driven by growth in its cloud and advertising businesses.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_28-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The company reported net sales of $158.9 billion, up 11% from the year-ago period and above the $157.3 billion Wall Street expected, according to analyst estimates compiled by Visible Alpha. <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/eps.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Earnings per share</a> (EPS) grew more than 50% to $1.43, beating analysts’ forecasts.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_29-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon stock rose nearly 5% in extended trading on Thursday, after declining more than 3% in the regular session. Still, shares were up 22% for the year before the stock’s post-earnings jump, slightly outpacing the Nasdaq Composite over the same period.
</p>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_30-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-universal-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme mntl-sc-block-image inline-image figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_31-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Revenue at Amazon Web Services, the company’s cloud computing unit, rose 19% to $27.4 billion, roughly in line with expectations. The division’s revenue growth has accelerated into the high teens this year after holding in the low teens in 2023.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_32-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon forecast fourth-quarter net sales would be within a range of $183.5 billion to $188.5 billion, the midpoint of which sat slightly below the $186.4 billion figure analysts were expecting, per Visible Alpha.<br/>
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_33-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Advertising sales increased 19% to $14.3 billion, about in line with analysts' expectations for one of Amazon’s greenest and fastest-growing revenue streams. 
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_34-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/capitalexpenditure.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Capital expenditures</a> (CapEx) increased 5% from last year to $22.2 billion. Amazon, locked in an AI arms race with cloud-computing peers Microsoft (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=MSFT" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">MSFT</a>) and Alphabet (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=GOOG" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">GOOG</a>; <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=GOOGL" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="4">GOOGL</a>), has significantly boosted its spending on data center infrastructure this year.<br>
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_35-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> -<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/colin-laidley-5218536" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"><em>Colin Laidley</em></a>
</p></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-adslot_4-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block" data-item-index="4"></div>
<div id="mntl-liveblog-item_5-0" class="comp mntl-liveblog-item mntl-block"><span class="heading-toc" id="toc-2024-10-31t211439895z"></span>
<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_5-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Intel Jumps in Extended Trading as Sales Top Estimates</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_5-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 05:14 PM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_5-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t211439895z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_36-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Intel (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=INTC" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">INTC</a>) reported third-quarter revenue that topped analysts' expectations, sending shares higher after the bell Thursday despite widening losses.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_37-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The chipmaker's third-quarter revenue fell 6% year-over-year to $13.3 billion, above the $13.03 billion consensus estimate of analysts compiled by Visible Alpha. Intel posted a wider-than-expected loss of $16.6 billion, after reporting a $1.61 billion loss in the second quarter as the chipmaker works to cut costs. A year ago, the chipmaker had reported a profit of around $300 million.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_38-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html">  Intel said it anticipates fourth-quarter revenue of $13.3 billion to $14.3 billion, compared to a consensus estimate of $13.66 billion. It projects a loss of 24 cents per share, steeper than the loss of 12 cents per share analysts had been expecting. 
</p>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_39-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-universal-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme mntl-sc-block-image inline-image figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

<p id="mntl-sc-block_40-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Intel's results come as the storied chipmaker tries to turn around the business after <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/intel-stock-one-disaster-after-another-chip-stocks-wall-street-8710894" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">losing market share to competitors</a> and missing key opportunities to benefit from the boom in demand for <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/artificial-intelligence-ai.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">artificial intelligence (AI)</a>. Shares took a hit in recent months as worries mounted about its ability to <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/intel-latest-plans-send-stock-soaring-what-you-need-to-know-8713590" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">engineer a comeback</a> after <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/intel-q2-fy2024-earnings-8687792" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="4">reporting wider-than-expected losses in the prior quarter</a> and announcing massive layoffs.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_41-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Intel shares were up 9% in recent after-hours trading. The stock was down more than 57% for the year through Thursday's close, making it one of the worst-performing S&P 500 stocks of the year.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_42-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> -<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/kara-greenberg-5188135" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"><em>Kara Greenberg</em></a><br>
</p></div>

<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_6-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>What Analysts Think of Apple Heading Into Earnings</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_6-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 03:48 PM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_6-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t194819939z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_43-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Apple (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=AAPL" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">AAPL</a>) will report <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/apple-q4-fy-2024-earnings-preview-8734810" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">fiscal fourth-quarter earnings</a> after the market closes on Thursday, with a majority of analysts bullish on the stock going into the company’s first report since the iPhone 16’s release last month.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_44-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Of the 15 analysts covering the stock tracked by Visible Alpha, nine have “buy” or equivalent ratings, four have “hold” ratings, and two have “sell.” Their consensus price estimate is $240.87.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_45-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Apple shares were down 1.4% at $226.90 in late trading Thursday.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_46-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> -<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/andrew-kessel-8670381" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"><em>Andrew Kessel</em></a>
</p></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-adslot_6-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block" data-item-index="6"></div>
<div id="mntl-liveblog-item_7-0" class="comp mntl-liveblog-item mntl-block"><span class="heading-toc" id="toc-2024-10-31t182359325z"></span>
<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_7-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Estée Lauder Stock Dives on China Softness, Dividend Cut</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_7-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 02:23 PM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_7-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t182359325z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_47-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Estée Lauder (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=EL" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">EL</a>) shares tanked 20% Thursday after the luxury beauty products maker warned about softness in China and the Asia travel market, pulled its full-year guidance, and cut its dividend.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_48-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The news came a day after the company named Executive Group President Stéphane de La Faverie its new <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/ceo.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Chief Executive Officer (CEO)</a>, effective Jan. 1.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_49-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Estée Lauder reported fiscal 2025 first-quarter revenue fell 4% year-over-year to $3.36 billion, while analysts surveyed by Visible Alpha expected $3.37 billion. Adjusted <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/eps.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">earnings per share (EPS)</a> of $0.14 exceeded forecasts.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_50-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/o/organic-sales.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Organic sales</a> declined 5%, which the company blamed primarily on "worsened consumer sentiment in China that drove further softening in overall prestige beauty in mainland China and low conversion rates in Asia travel retail and Hong Kong SAR." Organic sales were also dragged down by "lower replenishment orders in Asia travel retail, including inventory pressure given the further retail market deceleration."
</p>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_51-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-universal-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme mntl-sc-block-image inline-image figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">
<div class="img-placeholder" style="padding-bottom:66.6%;">

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_52-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Estée Lauder explained that because of the "complex prestige beauty landscape" and uncertainty about the recovery of the China and Asia travel markets, it was reducing its quarterly dividend to $0.35 from $0.66.3
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_53-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> In addition, it cited those factors, plus the change in leadership, for the decision to withdraw its fiscal 2025 outlook. It previously had anticipated adjusted EPS of $2.75 to $2.95, and revenue "between a decrease of 1% to an increase of 2% versus the prior year."
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_54-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> -<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/bill-mccoll-5186338" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"><em>Bill McColl</em></a>
</p></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-adslot_7-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block" data-item-index="7"></div>
<div id="mntl-liveblog-item_8-0" class="comp mntl-liveblog-item mntl-block"><span class="heading-toc" id="toc-2024-10-31t170950095z"></span>
<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_8-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Robinhood Stock Sinks as Promotions Hurt Earnings</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_8-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 01:09 PM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_8-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t170950095z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_55-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Robinhood Markets (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=HOOD" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">HOOD</a>) shares sank 15% Thursday, a day after the online brokerage posted worse-than-expected results as a promotion to get more customers affected performance.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_56-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The company posted third-quarter <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/eps.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">earnings per share (EPS)</a> of $0.17, with revenue jumping 36% year-over-year to $637 million. Both were short of consensus forecasts by analysts polled by Visible Alpha.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_57-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Robinhood said that revenue was reduced by $27 million "due to matches paid to customers on transfers and deposits." CFO Jason Warnick said in the earnings call that these "contra revenues" are anticipated to grow sequentially by a similar amount in the current quarter, before slowing next year, according to a transcript provided by AlphaSense.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_58-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Warnick noted that the company's gold deposit boost "has not driven as much incremental customer activity as our other promotions." Still, Robinhood noted that an increase in gold subscriptions was the primary reason its "other revenues" gained 42%. Transaction-based revenues were up 72% on higher options, cryptocurrency, and equities trades. Net interest revenues climbed 9%.
</p>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_59-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-universal-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme mntl-sc-block-image inline-image figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

<figcaption id="mntl-figure-caption_6-0" class="comp mntl-figure-caption type--mouse figure-caption figure-article-caption"> <span class="figure-article-caption-owner"><p>TradingView</p></span>
</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_60-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Shares of Robinhood Markets fell from a nearly three-year high, but even so, they're up almost 90% year-to-date. They got a boost earlier this week when the company announced it was <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/robinhood-launches-contracts-to-allow-investors-to-bet-on-us-presidential-election-outcome-8735258" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">offering</a> clients the ability to trade on the outcome of the U.S. presidential election.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_61-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> -<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/bill-mccoll-5186338" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"><em>Bill McColl</em></a>
</p></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-adslot_8-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block" data-item-index="8"></div>

<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_9-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Microsoft Stock Slumps on Disappointing Forecast</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_9-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 11:57 AM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_9-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t155749648z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_62-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Shares of Microsoft (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=MSFT" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">MSFT</a>) slid on Thursday after the company’s revenue forecast fell short of Wall Street’s estimates<em> </em>and<em> </em>the cloud computing giant struggles to meet demand. 
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_63-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Shares were down nearly 6% Thursday morning, weighing on the shares of some of its Big Tech peers. The slump slashed the stock's year-to-date gain—once as high as 24%—to just 8%.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_64-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Microsoft on Wednesday forecast revenue at its Intelligent Cloud division would grow 18% to 20% in the current quarter, below analysts’ estimates. Growth of Azure, its cloud-computing platform, is expected to come in around 31% or 32%, a deceleration from the most recent quarter and slightly slower than Wall Street expected. The disappointing forecast overshadowed the company’s fiscal first-quarter results, which broadly <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/microsoft-q1-fy-2025-earnings-8736873" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">exceeded expectations</a>. 
</p>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_65-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-universal-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme mntl-sc-block-image inline-image figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

<p id="mntl-sc-block_66-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Microsoft has struggled to meet surging AI demand, a difficulty executives <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/microsoft-says-it-is-seeing-more-demand-for-ai-than-it-can-keep-up-with-8737280" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">expect to persist</a> in the current quarter. CFO Amy Hood on the company's earnings call expressed confidence that growth would pick up in the first half of next year as more cloud computing capacity came online.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_67-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Analysts on Thursday were sanguine about the outlook. They pointed to comments from executives indicating demand for AI services remains strong, and that the company’s increased spending on AI infrastructure should help it to meet that demand in the future. 
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_68-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Read the <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/microsoft-stock-slumps-weighing-on-big-tech-shares-on-disappointing-forecast-8737497" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">full article here.</a>
</p>

</p></div>
