<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_10-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Peloton Soars After Strong Results, Naming of CEO</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_10-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 10:43 AM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_10-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t144336595z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_70-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Shares of fitness company Peloton Interactive (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=PTON" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">PTON</a>) soared 25% in early trading Thursday after its fiscal first-quarter results topped analysts' estimates and it appointed Ford executive Peter Stern as its new CEO.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_71-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Peloton reported a net loss of just $1 million, an improvement of $158 million year-over-year and much narrower than the $51.7 million loss expected by analysts polled by Visible Alpha. Revenue of $586.0 million also surpassed projections.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_72-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Stern, who currently serves as president of Ford Integrated Services and previously was an executive at Apple (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=AAPL" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">AAPL</a>), will begin his new roles on Jan. 1. In May, Peloton announced Barry McCarthy was stepping down as CEO and that the board had "initiated a comprehensive search process" to find its next leader.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_73-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> With today's surge, Peloton has gained 35% in 2024, far outpacing the S&P 500's gains.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_74-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> -<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/rob-mclean-8724526" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1"><em>Rob McLean</em></a>
</p></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-adslot_10-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block" data-item-index="10"></div>
<div id="mntl-liveblog-item_11-0" class="comp mntl-liveblog-item mntl-block"><span class="heading-toc" id="toc-2024-10-31t142257760z"></span>
<h2 id="mntl-blogpost__headline_11-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__headline mntl-text-block"><p><strong>Uber Stock Plunges as Q3 Bookings Numbers Disappoint</strong></p></h2>
<div id="mntl-blogpost__publishedDate_11-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__publishedDate mntl-text-block">October 31, 2024 10:22 AM EDT</div>
<button id="mntl-blogpost__copylink_11-0" class="comp mntl-blogpost__copylink mntl-copy-link-button mntl-button" data-link="https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10312024-8737333#toc-2024-10-31t142257760z" aria-label="Copy Link">
</button>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_75-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/personal-finance/111015/story-uber.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Uber Technologies</a> (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=uber" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">UBER</a>) shares fell sharply early Thursday after the ride-hailing giant posted weaker-than-expected gross bookings in the third quarter.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_76-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The company said gross bookings rose 16% year-over-year to $41 billion in the third quarter, below estimates from Visible Alpha of $41.3 billion. Trips grew 17% to 2.9 billion, in line with estimates. 
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_77-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Uber's top- and bottom-line results handily <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/uber-q3-fy-2024-earnings-preview-8735363" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">beat analysts'</a> estimates, however. The company reported revenue for the period of $11.19 billion versus the $10.98 billion estimate. <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/n/netincome.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">Net income</a> of $2.6 billion also beat estimates by a wide margin, although that included a $1.7 billion pre-tax benefit from gains in Uber's revaluation of its equity investments.
</p>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_78-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi noted that the company is continuing "to advance our autonomous strategy." Uber has announced a <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/4-key-takeaways-from-uber-q1-2024-earnings-call-8645164" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">number of partnerships</a> with autonomous vehicle companies like Waymo over the last several months.
</p>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_79-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-universal-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme mntl-sc-block-image inline-image figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

<p id="mntl-sc-block_83-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The stock has recently reclaimed the 200-week moving average and sits poised to break out above the upper trendline of a rising wedge pattern. title: Amazon Stock Jumps on Earnings Beat, Cloud Growth
text:
Amazon (AMZN) stock jumped in extended trading Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected third-quarter results driven by growth in its cloud and advertising businesses.

The company reported net sales of $158.9 billion, up 11% from the year-ago period and above the $157.3 billion Wall Street expected, according to analyst estimates compiled by Visible Alpha. Earnings per share (EPS) grew more than 50% to $1.43, beating analysts’ forecasts.

Revenue at Amazon Web Services, the company’s cloud computing unit, rose 19% to $27.4 billion, roughly in line with expectations. The division’s revenue growth has accelerated into the high teens this year after holding in the low teens in 2023.

Amazon forecast fourth-quarter net sales would fall within a range of $181.5 billion to $188.5 billion, the midpoint of which sat slightly below the $186.4 billion figure analysts were expecting, per Visible Alpha.

Amazon stock rose 6% in late trading on Thursday, after declining more than 3% in the regular session. Still, shares were up 22% for the year before the stock’s post-earnings jump.

Advertising sales increased 19% to $14.3 billion, about in line with analysts' expectations for one of Amazon’s greenest and fastest-growing revenue streams.

Capital expenditures (CapEx) increased 5% from last year to $22.2 billion. Amazon, locked in an AI arms race with cloud-computing peers Microsoft (MSFT) and Alphabet (GOOG; GOOGL), has significantly boosted its spending on data center infrastructure this year.



Correction: The low end of Amazon's fourth-quarter revenue guidance was $181.5 billion. An earlier version of this article incorrectly said it was $183.5 billion.

</div><div class="loc article-content"><div id="article__primary-video-container--jw_1-0" class="comp article__primary-video-container--jw mntl-block"></div>
<div id="article-body_1-0" class="comp article-body mntl-block" data-contain-tooltips="true"><div id="mntl-sc-page_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-page mntl-block article-body-content" data-sc-sticky-offset="80" data-sc-ad-label-height="0" data-sc-ad-track-spacing="90" data-sc-min-track-height="250" data-sc-max-track-height="600" data-sc-breakpoint="50em" data-sc-load-immediate="1" data-sc-content-positions="[300, 1, 1, 1250, 1, 1, 1, 1]" data-bind-scroll-on-start="true"><p id="mntl-sc-block_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=AMZN" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">AMZN</a>) stock jumped in extended trading Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected third-quarter results driven by growth in its cloud and advertising businesses.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_2-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_3-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The company reported net sales of $158.9 billion, up 11% from the year-ago period and above the $157.3 billion Wall Street expected, according to analyst estimates compiled by Visible Alpha. <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/eps.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Earnings per share</a> (EPS) grew more than 50% to $1.43, beating analysts’ forecasts.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="1"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_4-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_5-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Revenue at Amazon Web Services, the company’s cloud computing unit, rose 19% to $27.4 billion, roughly in line with expectations. The division’s revenue growth has accelerated into the high teens this year after holding in the low teens in 2023.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_6-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_7-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon forecast fourth-quarter net sales would fall within a range of $181.5 billion to $188.5 billion, the midpoint of which sat slightly below the $186.4 billion figure analysts were expecting, per Visible Alpha.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_8-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_9-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon stock rose 6% in late trading on Thursday, after declining more than 3% in the regular session. Still, shares were up 22% for the year before the stock’s post-earnings jump.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_10-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_11-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Advertising sales increased 19% to $14.3 billion, about in line with analysts' expectations for one of Amazon’s greenest and fastest-growing revenue streams. 
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_12-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_13-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/capitalexpenditure.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Capital expenditures</a> (CapEx) increased 5% from last year to $22.2 billion. Amazon, locked in an AI arms race with cloud-computing peers Microsoft (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=MSFT" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">MSFT</a>) and Alphabet (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=GOOG" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">GOOG</a>; <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=GOOGL" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="4">GOOGL</a>), has significantly boosted its spending on data center infrastructure this year.<br>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_14-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_15-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <strong>Correction</strong>: The low end of Amazon's fourth-quarter revenue guidance was $181.5 billion. An earlier version of this article incorrectly said it was $183.5 billion.
</p>

title: What You Need To Know Ahead of Amazon's Earnings
text:
UPDATE—Oct. 31, 2024: This article has been updated to reflect more recent analyst estimates and share price information.

Key Takeaways Amazon reports earnings after the market closes Thursday, with analysts expecting profits to fall from the prior quarter but rise from a year ago.

Investors will likely be watching the tech giant's margins amid concerns consumer weakness, growing labor costs, and higher spending on artificial intelligence could squeeze profits.

Analysts have suggested Amazon's high-margin advertising revenue and AWS growth could help offset the costs.

Amazon (AMZN) reports earnings after the bell Thursday, with investors likely to be watching the tech giant's margins amid concerns consumer weakness, growing labor costs, and higher spending on artificial intelligence (AI) could squeeze profits.

Amazon shares took a hit after the company released its second-quarter report in July, as its quarterly sales and outlook missed expectations. Since then, shares have largely recovered to their level before the report, leaving them about 23% higher for the year so far at $186.68 in Thursday afternoon trading.

Analysts expect Amazon's third-quarter revenue to come in at $157.27 billion, up from the prior quarter and year-ago period. However, profits are projected to fall sequentially to $12.38 billion as expenses climb, despite rising roughly 25% year-over-year.

</figcaption></figure>
</div><div class="loc article-content"><div id="article__primary-video-container--jw_1-0" class="comp article__primary-video-container--jw mntl-block"></div>
<div id="article-body_1-0" class="comp article-body mntl-block" data-contain-tooltips="true"><div id="mntl-sc-page_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-page mntl-block article-body-content" data-sc-sticky-offset="80" data-sc-ad-label-height="0" data-sc-ad-track-spacing="90" data-sc-min-track-height="250" data-sc-max-track-height="600" data-sc-breakpoint="50em" data-sc-load-immediate="1" data-sc-content-positions="[300, 1, 1, 1250, 1, 1, 1, 1]" data-bind-scroll-on-start="true"><p id="mntl-sc-block_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <em>UPDATE—Oct. 31, 2024: This article has been updated to reflect more recent analyst estimates and share price information.</em>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_2-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_3-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-callout mntl-block"><div id="mntl-sc-block_4-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-callout mntl-block theme-whatyouneedtoknow" data-tracking-id="mntl-sc-block-callout" data-tracking-container="true"><h3 id="mntl-sc-block-callout-heading_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-callout-heading mntl-text-block">Key Takeaways</h3>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-callout-body_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-callout-body mntl-text-block"><ul><li>Amazon reports earnings after the market closes Thursday, with analysts expecting profits to fall from the prior quarter but rise from a year ago.</li><li>Investors will likely be watching the tech giant's margins amid concerns consumer weakness, growing labor costs, and higher spending on artificial intelligence could squeeze profits.</li><li>Analysts have suggested Amazon's high-margin advertising revenue and AWS growth could help offset the costs.</li></ul></div></div></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_5-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=AMZN" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">AMZN</a>) reports earnings after the bell Thursday, with investors likely to be watching the tech giant's margins amid concerns consumer weakness, growing labor costs, and higher spending on <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/artificial-intelligence-ai.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">artificial intelligence (AI)</a> could squeeze profits.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="1"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_6-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_7-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon shares took a hit after the company released its <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/amazon-s-aws-revenue-continues-to-grow-guidance-comes-up-short-8687730" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">second-quarter report</a> in July, as its quarterly sales and outlook missed expectations. Since then, shares have largely recovered to their level before the report, leaving them about 23% higher for the year so far at $186.68 in Thursday afternoon trading.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_8-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_9-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Analysts expect Amazon's third-quarter <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/revenue.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">revenue</a> to come in at $157.27 billion, up from the prior quarter and year-ago period. However, <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/n/netincome.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">profits</a> are projected to fall sequentially to $12.38 billion as expenses climb, despite rising roughly 25% year-over-year.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="2"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_10-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_11-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-table mntl-sc-block-table js-table-scroll"> <div class="mntl-sc-block-table__table-wrapper">
<table class="mntl-sc-block-table__table">
<colgroup style="" span="1"></colgroup>
<colgroup style="" span="1"></colgroup>
<colgroup style="" span="1"></colgroup>

<div id="mntl-sc-block_12-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-key-metrics-aws-advertising-revenue"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_13-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> Key Metrics: AWS, Advertising Revenue </span> </h2>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_14-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/investing/011316/what-amazon-web-services-and-why-it-so-successful.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Amazon Web Services (AWS)</a> and a growing advertising business for showing ads on Prime Video have been key sources of <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/amazon-q1-fy2024-earnings-8641382" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">revenue growth</a> so far this year. A migration to cloud storage and growing use of AI products have helped boost AWS revenue. Jefferies analysts said recently their checks suggest growing AWS revenue in the third quarter.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="5"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_15-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_16-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The analysts also said they have seen "solid & improving" demand for ad spending with Amazon. Wedbush analysts said they believe high-margin ad revenue could help offset big spending from Amazon to fuel its AI efforts, along with things like <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/amazon-stock-bull-case-wolfe-research-analysts-outperform-8678537" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Project Kuiper</a>, its planned satellite broadband project.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="6"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_17-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-business-spotlight-returns-on-ai-spending"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_18-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> Business Spotlight: Returns on AI Spending </span> </h2>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_19-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> A number of big tech companies including Amazon face <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/what-we-learned-from-big-tech-earnings-q2-2024-microsoft-apple-amazon-meta-8687917" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">pressure from investors</a> to show that their spending on AI is paying off. Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said in the company's <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/4-key-takeaways-from-amazon-q1-2024-earnings-call-8641033" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">first-quarter earnings call</a> that it wouldn't be spending so much on AI if it didn't see "very clear signals" that Amazon could monetize it.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_20-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_21-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> JPMorgan analysts told clients earlier this month it will be important for Amazon, along with other tech giants, to "highlight their early returns on AI spending" in their earnings calls.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="4"></span>
</p>

title: Watch These Amazon Price Levels as Stock Jumps After Cloud Growth Drives Earnings Beat
text:
Key Takeaways Amazon shares rose 6% in extended trading on Thursday after the company surpassed Wall Street’s third-quarter earnings estimates, boosted by growth in its cloud business and healthy e-commerce sales.

The stock sits poised to break out from a symmetrical triangle following the company’s better-than-expected quarterly report.

Investors should watch key overhead price levels on Amazon's chart around $200, $242, and $273, while also monitoring an important support area during profit taking periods near $192.

Amazon (AMZN) shares rose 6% in extended trading on Thursday after the company surpassed Wall Street’s third-quarter earnings estimates, boosted by growth in its cloud business and healthy e-commerce sales.

The company said Amazon Web Services (AWS) revenue increased 19% in the three-month period, marking the segment's fastest growth in seven quarters. Meanwhile, online stores revenue grew 7% from a year earlier, with the tech giant saying it anticipates a strong holiday quarter amid improved shipping times and a larger range of lower-cost items.

Prior to Thursday’s afterhours jump, Amazon shares had gained about 23% in 2024, slightly outpacing the S&P 500 index’s return over the same period.

Below, we analyze the technicals on Amazon’s chart and identify important post-earnings price levels worth watching.

Symmetrical Triangle Breakout

Since setting their record high in early July, Amazon shares have traded within a symmetric triangle, a chart pattern that indicates a consolidation in price before a potential breakout, usually in the direction of the prevailing trend.

Indeed, the stock sits poised to stage an upside breakout following the company’s better-than-expected quarterly report.

Let’s look at a key overhead level and several chart-based price targets on Amazon’s chart, while also pointing out an important support area during periods of profit taking.

Key Overhead Price Levels to Watch

The first level to watch sits around $200, an area that may come into play on Friday where the shares could face overhead resistance near the stock’s all-time high (ATH) and psychological round number.

Measuring Principle Price Target

To forecast an upside price target above the ATH, we can use a technical tool called the measuring principle. We do this by calculating the distance between the symmetrical triangle’s two trendlines near the start of the pattern and add that amount to the breakout point. In this case, we add $50 to $192, which predicts a target of $242.

Bars Pattern Price Target

Investors can speculate a longer-term bullish price target by applying a bars pattern, a technique that uses prior trends on the chart to predict future directional moves.

This works by taking Amazon’s trending move from October last year to April this year and overlaying the pattern from the most recent low, which forecasts a target of around $273. We selected this move as it commenced from an earnings-driven gap following the company’s equivalent quarter results last year.

Important Support Area to Monitor

During periods of profit-taking, investors should keep an eye on the $192 region. This area could attract buying interest near the stock’s initial breakout point, which also closely aligns with two prominent peaks that formed on the chart in April and May.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.

</div><div class="loc article-content"><div id="article__primary-video-container--jw_1-0" class="comp article__primary-video-container--jw mntl-block"></div>
<div id="article-body_1-0" class="comp article-body mntl-block" data-contain-tooltips="true"><div id="mntl-sc-page_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-page mntl-block article-body-content" data-sc-sticky-offset="80" data-sc-ad-label-height="0" data-sc-ad-track-spacing="90" data-sc-min-track-height="250" data-sc-max-track-height="600" data-sc-breakpoint="50em" data-sc-load-immediate="1" data-sc-content-positions="[300, 1, 1, 1250, 1, 1, 1, 1]" data-bind-scroll-on-start="true"><div id="mntl-sc-block_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-callout mntl-block"><div id="mntl-sc-block_2-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-callout mntl-block theme-whatyouneedtoknow" data-tracking-id="mntl-sc-block-callout" data-tracking-container="true"><h3 id="mntl-sc-block-callout-heading_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-callout-heading mntl-text-block">Key Takeaways</h3>
<div id="mntl-sc-block-callout-body_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block-callout-body mntl-text-block"><ul><li>Amazon shares rose 6% in extended trading on Thursday after the company surpassed Wall Street’s third-quarter earnings estimates, boosted by growth in its cloud business and healthy e-commerce sales.</li><li>The stock sits poised to break out from a symmetrical triangle following the company’s better-than-expected quarterly report.</li><li>Investors should watch key overhead price levels on Amazon's chart around $200, $242, and $273, while also monitoring an important support area during profit taking periods near $192.</li></ul></div></div></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_3-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Amazon (<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/markets/quote?tvwidgetsymbol=amzn" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">AMZN</a>) shares rose 6% in extended trading on Thursday after the company surpassed Wall Street’s third-quarter earnings estimates, boosted by <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/amazon-stock-jumps-on-earnings-beat-cloud-growth-update-8737937" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">growth in its cloud business</a> and healthy <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/ecommerce.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">e-commerce</a> sales.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="1"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_4-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_5-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The company said Amazon Web Services (AWS) revenue increased 19% in the three-month period, marking the segment's fastest growth in seven quarters.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="2"></span> Meanwhile, online stores revenue grew 7% from a year earlier, with the tech giant saying it anticipates a strong holiday quarter amid improved shipping times and a larger range of lower-cost items.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="3"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_6-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_7-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Prior to Thursday’s afterhours jump, Amazon shares had gained about 23% in 2024, slightly outpacing the <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sp500.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">S&P 500 index’s</a> return over the same period. 
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_8-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_9-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Below, we analyze the technicals on Amazon’s chart and identify important post-earnings price levels worth watching.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_10-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-symmetrical-triangle-breakout"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_11-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> Symmetrical Triangle Breakout </span> </h2>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_12-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Since setting their record high in early July, Amazon shares have traded within a <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/symmetricaltriangle.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">symmetric triangle</a>, a chart pattern that indicates a <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/consolidation.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">consolidation</a> in price before a potential <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/trading/08/trading-breakouts.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="3">breakout</a>, usually in the direction of the prevailing trend.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_13-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_14-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Indeed, the stock sits poised to stage an upside breakout following the company’s better-than-expected quarterly report.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_15-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_16-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Let’s look at a key overhead level and several chart-based price targets on Amazon’s chart, while also pointing out an important <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/support.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">support</a> area during periods of profit taking.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_17-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-key-overhead-price-levels-to-watch"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_18-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> Key Overhead Price Levels to Watch </span> </h2>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_19-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> The first level to watch sits around $200, an area that may come into play on Friday where the shares could face overhead resistance near the stock’s <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/active-trading/051315/how-trade-stocks-hit-alltime-highs.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">all-time high (ATH)</a> and <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/technical/02/061802.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">psychological</a> round number.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_20-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<h3 id="mntl-sc-block_21-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-subheading mntl-sc-block-subheading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-subheading__text"> Measuring Principle Price Target </span> </h3>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_22-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> To forecast an upside <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pricetarget.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">price target</a> above the ATH, we can use a technical tool called the <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/measuring-principle.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">measuring principle</a>. We do this by calculating the distance between the symmetrical triangle’s two trendlines near the start of the pattern and add that amount to the breakout point. In this case, we add $50 to $192, which predicts a target of $242.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_23-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<h3 id="mntl-sc-block_24-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-subheading mntl-sc-block-subheading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-subheading__text"> Bars Pattern Price Target </span> </h3>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_25-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> Investors can speculate a longer-term bullish price target by applying a bars pattern, a technique that uses prior <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/trendanalysis.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">trends</a> on the chart to predict future directional moves.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_26-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_27-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> This works by taking Amazon’s trending move from October last year to April this year and overlaying the pattern from the most recent low, which forecasts a target of around $273. We selected this move as it commenced from an earnings-driven <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/g/gap.asp" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">gap</a> following the company’s equivalent quarter results last year.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_28-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-important-support-area-to-monitor"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_29-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> Important Support Area to Monitor </span> </h2>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_30-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block finance-sc-block-html mntl-sc-block-html"> During periods of <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profittaking.asp#:~:text=Profit%2Dtaking%20is%20selling%20a,stock%20price%20or%20equity%20index." data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">profit-taking</a>, investors should keep an eye on the $192 region. This area could attract buying interest near the stock’s initial breakout point, which also closely aligns with two prominent <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/trading/peak-and-trough-analysis/" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">peaks</a> that formed on the chart in April and May.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_31-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>

Read our <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/legal-4768893#toc-warranty-and-liability-disclaimer" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">warranty and liability disclaimer</a> for more info.</em>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_33-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>

</p>
